Reviews.Title: Gorgeous tv
Reviews.Author: sjones
Reviews.Content: This tv is a beauty to look at. You can tell it is built with greater quality and better materials than other 32 inch televisions, as well as other tvs in this price range. The bezel is small, and made of metal. It forms a nice border for the screen.  There is only the faint BRAVIA lettering on the left top corner. There is an energy star label in the lower right corner which can be peeled off. A small silver module at the front has the SONY logo with led lighting. It is a very minimalistic and modern looking television from the front view. At the back of the television it is thin from the top (only 0.5 inches thick), but at the bottom where the power unit and other electronic components are located it has a depth of 2.5 inches. The thin stainless steel is beautiful as it is functional. The tv sits rock solid and feels very secure. The stand has a foot print of 8 inches deep by 16 inches wide.So the main question is how is the picture quality? Well I am pleased to say that the picture quality is excellent! Blacks look truly black. THe color palette is pleasant and have a nice pop. The picture look more realistic compared to a 32 inch Samsung I demoed in store. The Samsung appeared over-saturated and images appear burnt out. THe Sony did a better job of showing a more even, realistic, and detailed image.I do not know if this is an IPS screen. Even if it wasn't the viewing angles are quite good. I had no issues with sitting off centre. Contrast and brightness are slightly decreased, but still fine. I was happy to note there was no brightness variations across the screen. The lighting is very even on my unit. The screen is somewhere between matte and gloss, so while glare is there it is not disturbing. Further because it is not as matte, as my previous Samsung monitor, the picture appears vibrant.The remote is nice to hold. It has a good feel, and the layout is nicely thought out. There are shortcut buttons to Netflix, the Sony Entertainment Network (SEN) hub, and Home. I would have liked it to have backlighting. I also wished it had a touch panel too.The Smart features are nice. Like I said already, this tv can connect to Netflix, and SEN. In the SEN screen you have an app for Youtube, NHL Game Center, Crackle, Picassa, etc to name a few. I noticed it was missing HULU which would have been nice to include. Connection to my wireless network was simple and quick. Accessing the apps were slighly sluggish at times. I had to wait for them to load, and some may find the few seconds frustrating. Generally browsing the apps was not such a painless endeavour, but neither is it too painful. I wished the speed was better. The tv has an internet browser. The problem is with trying to navigate web pages. Because it's all from the basic remote, and not a touch pad, it slows what is an easy task performed on a tablet or on a computer. You can connect to the tv with your tablet or smartphone to help with navigation in the Youtube app which makes searching or browsing for videos a whole lot faster.There are only two HDMI ports, and one USB port which is limiting. To connect to your stereo system you would need to use an optical digital audio cable. Or you can use a 3.5mm plug to RCA cable. There are no standard RCA outputs. The sound quality of the tv speaker is not bad. I just prefer to connect it to my Energy speakers, which sounds much better.I haven't tried much gaming with this tv. The motion is fine as far as I can tell. Didn't notice much issue with lag.There are lots of customizations for picture. There are several scene modes. You can also customize picture quality to the way you like with white balance, hues, saturation, brightness, and more. There are various picture enhancements in the menu which works well.The 32W650A is probably one of the best 32 inch television out there, although there is a small list to chose from. Most manufacturers are not interested in making 32 inch televisions these days, and instead focusing on larger tv displays. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality and detail the best I've seen on a TV but sound quality not as good as I was expecting
Reviews.Author: Jackie Davis
Reviews.Content: Here's the basics on what you need to know about this TV. First the picture quality in HD is among the best based on personal experience and the reviews I've read online. I did research on this TV and bought it according to reviews from credible sources and not just customer reviews. In the picture quality department it exceeded way beyond my expectations but the sound quality is something left to be desired which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 stars. In the end I ended up buying a separate sound bar for better quality sound. One other drawback is the lack of inputs. There are only two hdmi inputs, one composite and one av. It also has an optical input, LAN for internet, one usb, one audio out and cable input. Menu interface is user friendly, easy to understand with the help of the tutorial and I have nothing negative to say about it. If picture quality is important to you you can't go wrong with this TV but lack of quality sound and inputs is what's holding back a perfect score for this TV.

Reviews.Title: The best 32-inch Available - Period!
Reviews.Author: Jesse P
Reviews.Content: I won't go over what many have already stated on here, size - specs etc., what I'll cover is my personal experiences with this set, both pros and cons:KDL-32W650AThis review covers the use of this TV as a dedicated console and PC display only.  I did watch several Blu-rays and all of them were stellar on this set, better than any other I mention in the below comments, though my primary use was intended for gaming.Pros:- Stellar image quality - simply pristine, one of the best screen coatings I've seen (glossy, though little to no reflection, similar to Philips Moth Eye technology), definitely looks great. I compared this TV directly to several other units, using a variety of movies and games, both console and PC:LG: 32CS560, 32LN5700, 32LN530B (32LN530B is without question, the best 720p TV I've used).Samsung: UN40F6300 (TS01 and TU02) and the UN32F5500 (TS01)(literally no comparison, TU02 is exceptional in every regard), TS01 had a lot of back light bleeding, flashlight spots and overall poor uniformity, TU02 had none of these issues.Vizio M series: Beautiful TVs, though higher input lag and not as many options to tweak image settings.- Sony looked better than all of them except maybe the UN40F6300 TU02, real toss-up between the two - it comes down to a preference thing. Sony is slightly more muted, though realistic looking colors, they are not over saturated.  That said, the colors on the Samsung weren't either, though they have more of a pop to them, some will like this others will prefer the more muted/pastel look of the Sony.- Input lag - Sony all the way, every setting on the Sony has great input lag - sub 30ms, Samsung and LG both in game mode are in the 30's, LG higher 40's and that's in game mode.  Sony trumps everyone in this regard.  Samsung and LG are over 100ms using anything other than game mode.- Style and look, Sony - looks like a higher quality piece of equipment, feels like it as well, seems like a tank compared to the other models.- Sony Scene select is exceptional, about 10-12 individual calibration settings you can use with the click of one button, think game settings, movie mode, PC etc., Sony did an excellent job on this aspect.- X-Reality Pro on Sony is great, brings games to life - exceptional clarity and clean looking images.- Sony had no issues as far as back light bleeding, clouding or flash lighting, this is an area that two of three Samsung's I tried had issues, the LG's and Vizio were all pretty good in this regard.- Minimal blurring, better than all of the other sets. Samsung's PC mode is exceptional, literally no discernable blurring, though it lacks the color and clarity of the other modes.Cons:- Cost, simply too much money for a 32-inch TV in my opinion.- Only two HDMIs, especially given the cost and Sony's competition offering 3-4 on average.- Sound was not as good as I expected. All of the LG's had better sound than the other TV's I compared them to, LG's clear voice technology is outstanding.- Odd mounting procedures needed as others detailed, need to use supplied mount kit for VESA and other configurations, not a huge deal, though it's odd Sony took the approach they did.- The stand sets somewhat low compared to other configurations offered by competitors. I had to prop my KDL-32W650A on a platform so my Sony Sound Bar didn't obscure the screen.- Smart TV is on par with LG, though nowhere near as good as Samsung and Vizio - I would give Samsung the nod overall.- Only one USB port.- LED Motion Mode - laughable at best compared to the other sets, way too dark and has a strong flicker to it. Poorest implementation I've seen, literally useless in all but the most extreme circumstances.If you are absolutely set on getting a 32-inch with the best image quality, minimal image blurring and lowest input lag, look no further. However, I've decided to go with the UN40F6300 - Panel TU02, my reasoning: I was miffed at the overall price of the Sony, only two HDMIs and I thought Samsung was offering much more for my money, eight inches in diagonal size, more connectivity options, better interface and extremely similar in terms of image quality all for $50 less than the KDL-32W650A. I also wasn't planning to use it as a dedicated PC monitor. I played over 20 PC and console games in a side by side comparison and found the 40-inch was more what I was looking for ( I was sitting a approximately 5-7 feet away, mostly using a game pad). I don't think most would be happy to use the Sony as a desktop PC monitor, it's not bad in this regard, though up too close and you can start to see the pixel structure, compared to a smaller dot pitch on a dedicated LED PC monitor. I did use it as a dedicated PC gaming monitor for a few days, though couldn't get past the pixelization up close. Skyrim, L4D2 and many other games looked immaculate, it was games such as Age of Empires 3, Rome 2, Starcraft II and other mouse directed RTS and strategy games that looked pixelated up close. In closing, I'm fond of what Sony did with this set, though if the price was a bit more reasonable and it had more than two HDMIs, it would be a much more recommended and viable option for many, including myself.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but......
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: The picture is great and Sony has done a nice job with the menu, setup, etc., but there is one major drawback to be aware of.  This TV is NOT VESA compliant in terms of TV mounting.  You can NOT use a standard VESA TV mount.  The TV comes with a special mount that can be used to mount the TV flat against the wall using the supplied hardware, but it is impossible to use any full-motion, or any other VESA compliant mounts available anywhere.  I spoke to Sony support, and they confirmed that I am correct. So, if you are planning to mount your TV using a motion or angled wall mount, do not purchase this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great as a Computer Monitor & for PC gaming, but some adjustments required. Epic Contrast & Blacks. No PWM
Reviews.Author: Xel Adune
Reviews.Content: The Sony KDL-32W650A is great as a pc monitor, but you do need to dig a little deeper and change a few obscure settings for it to look good. EPIC Contrast & Black levels. Low input lag, minimal ghosting in dark scene transitions. No discernible PWM, or it runs on extremely high frequency.RECOMMENDED SETTINGS FOR PC & PC GAMING1. "Graphics or Game mode"  - Press OPTIONS button on remote / SCENE SELECT  Choose Graphics or Game mode  - what does it do: reduced input lag, both are fine for gaming.2. "Full RGB Dynamic Range"  - Press HOME button on remote / SETTINGS / PICTURE & DISPLAY / PRO PICTURE SETUP / DYNAMIC RANGE (change the hdmi port your pc is connected to to FULL)  - what does it do: better contrast, increased color range, much reduced motion ghosting.3. "Full Pixel"  - Press HOME on remote/ SETTINGS / PICTURE & DISPLAY  Screen Wide Mode: Full  Auto Wide: Off  Auto Display Area: Off  Display Area, FULL PIXEL  - what does it do: entire image in view, sharper image4. "Auto Dimming Off"  - Press HOME on remote / SETTINGS / PREFERENCES / ECO  Power Saving: Off  Light Sensor: Off  - what does it do: screen won't automatically change brightness, this feature doesn't work too well anyway.If you are looking for a small TV or a large Monitor for gaming that will make your games, especially dark games look incredible, the KDL-32W650A is perfect for the task. Again, this TV has no discernible PWM flicker, unless you turn on Led Motion Mode, not a very useful feature anyway since it dims the picture too much.

Reviews.Title: Tip for this and most Sony sets...
Reviews.Author: DaveC19
Reviews.Content: I won't go into details of this set as others have covered it. I do own this TV.  HOWEVER I do have an important TIP for anyone using this TV (and most Sony sets).  To get the sharpest picture and see the WHOLE image go into settings and set screen mode to "FULL PIXEL".  This is especially important for gaming.  All other modes SCALE and CROP your image!  Scaling can invoke a filter which will cause the image to be slightly fuzzy, and of course you lose some of your picture with the cropping.  So if you are inputting a 1080P signal the default setting will zoom in slightly and crop your picture!  Why they think a fuzzier image and loss of a decent portion of your picture is good is beyond me.  The "FULL PIXEL" setting, however,will give you a 1:1 pixel mapped picture on 1080P material giving you the full picture and sharpness.

Reviews.Title: Unusually high quality, TVs like this are rare
Reviews.Author: Home Theater Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I had thought they had stopped making TVs of this quality in this size range years ago. This TV easily surpasses Samsung's series 9 line, and is really the best looking screen I have owned in the past decade.Some other things I really like about this TV is the durable metal frame, a clear sign of quality. This TV also uniquely has an external power brick, which is actually a blessing because I have had 2 Samsung TVs deteriorate and die because of internal power supplies, which really only serve to produce heat inside the set. Because of this TVs external power brick, this Sony TV is cool running and gets mildly lukewarm at most, which should surely increase it's overall life.Also, even though this TV is advertised as just 60hz, it still has the smooth LED motion tech built in giving it the appearance of 120hz.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV Purchased for my bedroom :)
Reviews.Author: Yogesh Joshi
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV set. I ordered it 15 days back and I am loving it. It supports NTFS hard drive and can playback mkv files directly from it which is awesome. Picture and build quality is also very good.

Reviews.Title: First-rate Quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: Stephen Kimber
Reviews.Content: If you want stunning resolution, and don't mind paying for it, then this is a great choice.My bedroom is small, and therefore I was questioning the wisdom of a 32" screen.  My previous HDTV was a 22" Insignia, which was quite adequate, if not more so.  Trouble is, after three or four years, the screen wouldn't light up after powering it on.  So looked at many HDTVs and ended up buying a Samsung 26" (I forget the model number).  But I never could get a decent picture, even though I know my way around the settings.After reading many reviews on the Sony KDL-32W650A, I took the plunge and bought this product.  It was twice as expensive as its "peers," but worth every penny.Quality always trumps mediocrity.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional TV
Reviews.Author: Nome de Plume
Reviews.Content: Let's address sound quality first since this has been a chronic problem with flat screen televisions. I didn't like the sound quality at all when I previewed the 32W650A in the store and decided external speakers would be a necessity. After almost two months of viewing and listening, I still haven't installed satellite speakers because the Sony sound is actually quite nice. I might upgrade at some point but when it comes to audio quality, there is no doubt the environment has a very large influence on what the listener hears. The boxy location in my old entertainment unit obviously works well and enhances the backward firing speakers. I was even surprised at the sound quality while setting up the television on the work bench in the basement. My guess is that most locations outside the less than ideal retail display area will provide at least decent sonic quality. By the way, check out Audio Engine self powered speakers as a complement to this television.The smaller screen size, great processor, and terrific color dynamics all contribute to create a spectacular visual experience with HD input. The antenna feed with either 720p or 1080i signals continue to impress with a picture that is solid as a 35mm photo (Do you remember those?). The 480i over the air signals are certainly acceptable but I must confess that the standard definition signals delivered via Comcast suffered in comparison to being viewed on my old CRT televisions.Warning Will Robinson! If you subscribe only to standard (low definition) cable, keep your CRT television! Even HD cable broadcasts don't look as good as the antenna feed. To take advantage of this great TV I highly recommend using an antenna for the stations available in your area and then supplementing with cable stations into one of the two HDMI ports or the RCA inputs.Even though I thought the factory settings looked good, I used an IOS app called: "THX Tune-Up" to fine tune this set. It requires a $40 cable but was fun and easy using my wife's I-phone. Here's the URL to learn more:[...]The bottom line is I am delighted with this purchase. The video quality is so good that it even makes watching the news impressive.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-32W650A 32-Inch 60Hz 1080p Internet LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: G. Konrad
Reviews.Content: Great TV- after purchasing the Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz Smart LED HDTV - and returning it due to the uncontrollable darkening of the screen (due to eco settings)- and terrible image quality of netflix streaming- i ordered this. It was nearly twice the price, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great smaller TV
Reviews.Author: t2
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a smaller, additional TV, and went with this because we already have an older (2012) Sony smart TV.  The Sony app system has come a long way in 2 years.  It's very responsive and looks great.We use Windows phones and tablets, rather than Apple or Android.  Sony doesn't have a remote app for Windows, but we found one called Bravia Connect in the Windows and Windows Phone store.  It's a great alternative to the provided remote, especially in the dark, since the remote isn't backlit (the only thing I miss about my much older Samsung TV).

Reviews.Title: 120 NOT 60!
Reviews.Author: lothar
Reviews.Content: After trying initially a Samsung 32EH5300, I felt something was always amiss with image or motion or sound. Then discovered the February/March Sony Store (nearly $200 off) Sale, and that the W650 was either way sold out in any retailer such as BB, Futureshop etc. Got the TV and after doing the initial update, and tweaking the calibration, the image came out crisp, clear, colorful. The TV is 120, and was the only sub 40" such Sony. Should you check, they just just launched the 40" cousin of the 32".STURDY built! 8lbs heavier than the Samsung, and main reason? Has to be better more solid internal components. Samsung felt.. flimsy..Gamma, color, white balance, most factory settings are good. Had to adjust picture and brightness, and get the Standard Mode closer to Vivid. When done, the TV looks superb, and notches above any of the Samsung LEDs. Question is, is it worth the $75-150 over Samsungs? If you plan on watching it in a living room, bedroom, if you enjoy deep cinematic black, shudder free images, answer is yes. As one online reviewer wrote, it is indeed the best 32" in the industry.

Reviews.Title: Overall quality is worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D'Amario
Reviews.Content: An amazing 32-inch TV that will not leave you wanting for any imaginable feature... this truly comes fully loaded as far as audio/visual plug-ins and internal packaging...its wireless online capability is top notch). Superb picture quality, sound quite good (though recommend you run sound through a sound bar). Truly amplifies the pleasure of watching TV. I bought this for my wife who insists that anything larger than a 32-inch is too much for her personal viewing pleasure (my TV is significantly bigger, but that's another story). This is the 4th 32-inch she's had in the past 3 years and is, hands-down, the absolute best!

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable picture
Reviews.Author: Alfred Giordano Jr.
Reviews.Content: Nothing like a Sony picture. Perfect size for a bedroom. Metal frame and almost nonexistent bevel. This is not compatible with standard mounts, the wall mounting kit is included and it's ok. Just hangs on wall flat, which is fine for my situation. If you need a TV that needs to be adjusted on a wall, look elsewhere. Only downside is there are only 2 HDMI. Stupid. Some reviews complain about the sound. Out of the box the sound is horrible. Mess with the audio settings and you get infinitely better results. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: amazon warehouse deal!!
Reviews.Author: cc
Reviews.Content: bought this last week "used" from amazon warehouse deals... couldn’t be happier!item came in original box. all accessories were STILL SEALED. even the batteries!this TV had to be brand new. couldn’t beat the price. so let's defeat some cons people listed.no connection problems with my router. netflix works great, no stuttering whatsoever.does the stand suck? kind of. but hey, it looks awesome, it's sturdy, and lightweight. I only say "kind of" because if you wanted to place this tv on a smaller tv stand or something, you will be out of luck...since the stand is more of a bar than the traditional tv stands like we are used to. things will just fit between the spaces in the stand.picture looks amazing. remote and menus (including netflix) are snappy and fast.also, a big surprise for me, was the SPEAKER OUT options! there is a optical out like usual, BUT there is also a headphone jack that automatically disables your internal speakers when you have something plugged it! amazing!!!! seriously, the speaker on the tv aren’t great, but what do you expect with a tv that is so thin? just grab some good computer speakers, plug them into the headphone jack on the TV, and boom. awesome sound that you can STILL ADJUST with the remote!awesome TV!

Reviews.Title: Best picture I've ever seen
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing, the colors, details, the brightness, the darkness, this thing completely kills.  I watch a blue ray of a movie I have seen, it's almost alien, this thing is absolutely movie theater grade, it looks like a projector in a movie theater, but it's not, it's your tv.  In talking to a Sony rep, I learned most people go towards the brightest monitor, the brightest fire - from our caveman days, but that doesn't always mean it's the best monitor, the best fire.  There is a reason it costs more.  There is also a reason that Samsung is cheaper.  If you have a discerning eye, this thing is your friend.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture and features
Reviews.Author: Delta Whiskey "Delta Whiskey"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to install and get the setup done.  It is a great bedroom TV.  ALSO, A VERY GOOD PRICE.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and performance for games and movies
Reviews.Author: Vaughn Hollstein
Reviews.Content: -Picture is incredible. The X reality pro and full HD work perfectly together-Games look and play amazing. No noticeable input lag, great contrast, and fast paced motion looks great.-iManual is helpful and it is easy to navigate inputs via home screen-Stylish, sleek, and sexy-Setup was quick-Speakers are okay, I suggest buying a separate stereo system-The only trouble I had was getting the Miracast to work with my Android 4.2.2 HTC Desire 601-I would recommend getting a keyboard if you plan on using the internet capabilities or a phone with miracast or universal remote app.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic as an Elite High-End PC Monitor (Gaming, etc)
Reviews.Author: C. Vernon
Reviews.Content: This is an elite gaming monitor with full TV functionality, for a lower price than many monitors. Not to get too geeky, but it's the fastest in terms of least input lag. Elite performance. Perfect picture. It was easy to set up and took me 15 minutes to find and make all the settings, which are already done for you on the Internet in audiovisual forums by power users. The stand is excellent and the set also includes a free bracket for wall mount attachment.ETA: The very special price I received is no longer available.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous picture, so-so sound
Reviews.Author: NHShopper
Reviews.Content: As so many others have said, the picture is stunning but the sound does not impress. Frankly, I don't see how any 1" thick TV could have great sound. There are many settings on the tv, so play around with it a while and you can make the sound a little better.I bought the Sony HTCT260H Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer here on Amazon for under $200. It's not audiophile quality but for the price it sounds great. Jurassic Park was on tv just after I installed it and the subwoofer rocked the room. Of course if you're watching a HD DVD or HD broadcast the sound is much better than if it's just SD quality.Overall, the set up was very simple and I was impressed how easy it was to connect to my network. The Sony software makes it easy to access the usual streaming sites (Amazon, Netflix, many others).

Reviews.Title: It's good, but ....
Reviews.Author: Andrew Reminick
Reviews.Content: For the price I expected a stunning display with dead-on color. Maybe it's me, but the color on most channels has a slight greenish tint that cannot be corrected by messing with the onboard controls. The display is razor sharp though. The display is thin and attractive, but does not look to be made particularly sturdy, and the on off switch is in an awkward place on the back (why?). If you are putting this in a cabinet, your only option is the remote. Truthfully, I expected more for the money.

Reviews.Title: Best 32" period.
Reviews.Author: Weston
Reviews.Content: I can safely say that this will not disappoint you. Whether you are a gaming enthusiast or a lover of cinema, this TV will most definitely please you. The picture is very nice because of it's deep black levels that result in a plasma caliber picture, and delivered in such a time that even the most elite gamers will be challenged to criticize it. Not to mention the TV is loaded with convenient features such as the automatic scene change (my favorite because it will switch to cinema from game when you put in a movie though I do use the PS3 or PS4 when doing so), apps, screen mirroring, etc. Though I would have to say the only two gripes I can see someone having are the lacking of 3D (which I don't mind because that hurts my eyes after a bit anyway), and it only has 2 HDMI ports. However, if you are using a receiver with multiple HDMI's, one could argue it is unneccessary to have more than that. So really, they aren't truly rooted complaints but I can see how some wouldn't like that. So in my opinion, it is an amazing TV.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Jack Clompett
Reviews.Content: This TV has an amazing picture.  By far the sharpest and best color levels I've ever seen.  Plenty of inputs, plays nice with my PS3.  The TV remote even controls my PS3 through some sort of magic.  It's awesome.  Love Sony and love this TV.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture and Sound
Reviews.Author: Ron "Ron"
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted the best picture and best sound for this size, and he is happy with it.  We hung it from the wall in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: My Experience
Reviews.Author: denzel
Reviews.Content: I'm loving the LCD tv Sony Bravia it responses quick and has so many great features. Ps4 looks great on it two thumbs lol

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-32W65OA
Reviews.Author: Lynda "dragonlady"
Reviews.Content: Nice little tv for a bedroom. It was easy to set up and to connect to my gaming equipement and DVD player. I would've liked it to be a teeny bit bigger but the next size was too big for the only spot I had for it.

Reviews.Title: The GREATEST tv I've ever purchased!
Reviews.Author: bryanpm
Reviews.Content: This tv is fantastic! Probably the best picture quality I've seen in a long time. I bought this tv for my apartment, and it fits in perfectly. Great, durable quality! You will not regret buying this tv!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful images
Reviews.Author: meredith kemp
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV. I already have a Sony Bravia at home and needed this one for my new "mother-in-law' unit. Great picture. Slight problem with the audio...perhaps it's MY 87 YEAR OLD EARS!?

Reviews.Title: Finally, finally, FINALLY!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: It's been about 4 years of off and on decision making on getting a TV. I've had 10's of tv's over the past 4 years. Also PC monitors including the latest Asus 9ms input lag one.Every other TV or Monitor I've had either had horrible backlight bleed, or IPS glow which is a pain to view for movies. Every Samsung TV I've had all produced significant amounts of ghosting which is unbearable. I've had a few of them too, including the 32" 5500 series. The LG LM6200 I had was the last one I just had before it broke.Now with that LG gone. It was time to focus on what I wanted in a TV. Deep, deep black levels similar to a plasma. Neutral colors, nothing over saturated. No IPS glow, so IPS was out of question, a 32" as I would be using it as a PC monitor/ Gaming Console/ Movie watching.This Sony W650 is Incredible. It has less input lag than the LG IPS it replaced IMO. Now, IPS is known for low input lag, but this Sony VA panel definitely feels less laggy. Not only that, but the black levels are far better. The brightness is great as well. So great that I have it turned down all the way to 0 on the backlight. I'm in a completely dark room though, with just one light bulb. I was hoping to find a TV with a glass/ glossy screen with no Anti Glare coating. This TV does however uses a AG coating, but it's semi glossy. Similar to the LG. With that being said, web text is clear. I believe this tv is Chroma? 4:4:4 subsampling. Meaning, red text on a black background doesn't blur or have problems viewing. Colors are very neutral too. The tv sits pretty low too, so great as a PC monitor.Now, a little bit about the Smart features. It has A LOT! Vimeo, Amazon, and many more which I didn't really bother to remember. If you have a question about one, leave a comment and I'll let you know if it's available on the tv.The Optical out, does provide Dolby Digital 5.1 surround sound. I don't know what the speakers on the TV sound like as I use my Home Theater speakers so I can't comment on those, nor the USB/movie function. The Bezel is very minimal. About half and inch wide across the top and sides.The bottom bezel is about 1 inch. The majority of the top half of the TV is very slim, just as slim as the bezel. The bottom half is where it gets bulky in the back so make sure the location for this tv will have room.Now onto what I don't like about the TV.The Stand. It doesn't swivel, or tilt. It's just there holding the tv up. So when I get out of my desk to lay in bed, I can't just swivel the tv to point at my location. I have to turn the entire stand too, to where it needs to point at. Thus causing me to move my keyboard, mouse out into the middle of the desk. Just a small issue, but that's just my dislike. The tv has color shifting or so when I am viewing it from a standing position. It's not bad, but noticeable. The remote sensor is down at the bottom near the Sony logo. I put my keyboard on the tv stand to give a degree of angle to type a bit more comfortable. Sometimes I forget to move it back when I go to bed and then can't use the remote as the keyboard ends up blocking the sensor.All in all. This is hands down the best tv so far that I bought that fits all my needs. Gaming, and watching movies with an outstanding picture. Minimal input lag, very minimal ghosting/glare compared to the Samsung tv's. BUT not as perfect as TN/IPS/Plasma glare which isn't noticeable on those three imo. I hope this review helped a bit in your decision.If you have any questions, just comment back on this review and I'll try my best to help.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Alvin F. Outarsingh
Reviews.Content: Sony is the best, I will always buy Sony. This TV meets and beats my expectation. Cost is a concern however the long term you will recouped.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Xoszm
Reviews.Content: A blast when it comes to a entertainment companion, literally as this piece of luxury comes with breathtaking surround sound. The 1080p HD picture quality is astounding and gives the owner of this baby the right to boast. A must own Sony TV if you are a fan of 32-inch TVs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Arno17
Reviews.Content: Image quality is stunning, blacks are really black and the processor is really good with movement.Smart tv functionality is a great plus.Very satisfied even if expensive

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with another Sony product...
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: The 32" Sony we purchased is a good product.  We have several Sony products in our household and this one is another addition to the quality products we have experienced over the years of purchasing Sony products.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Richard A Nicolai
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular TV after reading the reviews others had posted.  I was not disappointed.  It was easy to set up, easy to use, and provides an excellent picture.  Have been using it for a month; no problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Buy this TV.
Reviews.Author: stardust
Reviews.Content: HD is everything it is said to be. This TV is smart (balances the light on the screen against light in the room), has a great picture, and makes you think you are looking at real people. Love it!!.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, thin and pleasant
Reviews.Author: Ca Tohza
Reviews.Content: Great TV smaller locations.  Picture is good and works well with Mac and Apple TV products.  Haven't bothered with internal features after a brief exploration as the Apple TV is better.

Reviews.Title: PAID FOR BUT NEVER SHIPS
Reviews.Author: Marcus Bashfield
Reviews.Content: Extremely poor service and had the nerve to blame the default on the likihood that the FedEx driver stole my television?  Really.

Reviews.Title: If You Want Internet Don't Buy This TV
Reviews.Author: Artist-Writer
Reviews.Content: The Sony company is marketing this product as an “Internet TV” but  access to web sites either does not work or does not appear as intended for the internet. Moreover, some movie applications, such as www.watch32 (hardly functional access through Sony)  and Amazon Prime Movies show icon-thumbnails which are so small that they are unreadable on the 32 inch screen. In this regard  I have a Roku on which all icons come through at a readable size with far fewer icons on the same screen. So my assumption is that the problem may be Sony factory programming which does not vary according to screen size. In any event, I have gone through three levels of not-helpful technical support that may be in  India. One of the technical support people said of the small pictures; "This is how it is supposed to be"  and explained that my difficulty is "because the screen is too small." He also told me that Sony considers the internet connection to be “merely incidental.”  Too bad, This is a great picture but I could not recommend the set to any of my friends.For another opinion see this review: [...]

Reviews.Title: DLNA media player will not play large video files
Reviews.Author: danT
Reviews.Content: Good picture, sound OK, remote cannot control other devices. The main problem I have with the Bravia TV is it cannot play large (epic) length movies streamed from a DLNA server.  The problem was only with long movies (mp4, m4v). The test movies were 2 hrs 56 min and 2 hr 42 min. Using HandBrake with the same settings as all my other movies, I split the movies in half. Then both halves played without any problems.

Reviews.Title: Horrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: marym
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this TV is absolutely terrible. The colors have a strange muted quality and the picture is dark, even when it is on the "vivid" setting.  Our last Sony has a crystal-clear picture and we were expecting at least as good with this TV.  It is basically unwatchable and we are very disappointed.  We wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
